pr_title: CLDR-13431 v36.1 final: update readme; copy emoji collation & annotations from v37

timeline.message:
CLDR-13431 v36.1 final: update readme; copy emoji collation & annotations
from master @d3ffc1b437c7b51ca5dad0051ac7dbd5674aa785

timeline.bodyText: Is that a U+FFFD before the € sign? Does that work with the ICU Collator?
timeline.author: markusicu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -947,20 +947,20 @@ For terms of use, see http://www.unicode.org/copyright.html
 &龠=\uFDD0龠 # radical 214
 				]]></cr>
 			</collation>
-<!-- Machine-readable version of the emoji ordering rules for v12.0 (corresponding to CLDR). -->
+<!-- Machine-readable version of the emoji ordering rules for v13.0 (corresponding to CLDR). -->
 <collation type='emoji'>
 <cr><![CDATA[
 # START AUTOGENERATED EMOJI ORDER
 & [last primary ignorable]<<*🦰🦱🦳🦲🏻🏼🏽🏾🏿
 & [before 1]﷑€

replies.bodyText: It is U+FDD1 and is already present in the ICU maint/maint-66 collation data, so no change there.
replies.author: pedberg-icu

replies.bodyText:
Oh, that makes sense.
Sorry, I just looked at it with a browser extension for Unicode properties, and I guess that turns noncharacter code points into U+FFFD for some reason...
Should have looked at the actual file.
replies.author: markusicu

replies.bodyText: PS: It would be clearer to have that one be escaped in the collation rules, as \uFDD1
replies.author: markusicu

replies.bodyText:
Good idea.
(I want to get unicodetools moved to github after the release; then we can keep track of improvements like this!)
replies.author: macchiati
